snippet: Some American lawmakers worry that a pathway to citizenship could encourage illegal immigration, but in some parts of Mexico there seem to be few people remaining to come.
abstract: Some American lawmakers worry that pathway to citizenship could encourage illegal immigration, but in some parts of Mexico there seem to be few people remaining to come; so many residents of Mexican villages are already in United States that it is unclear whether eased American citizenship rules would prompt any other Mexicans to try to immigrate.
lead_paragraph: Some American lawmakers worry that a pathway to citizenship could encourage illegal immigration, but in some parts of Mexico there seem to be few people remaining to come.

headline.seo: New Wave of Mexican Immigrants Seems Unlikely
headline.main: In Mexican Villages, Few Are Left to Dream of U.S.
headline.print_headline: In Mexican Villages, Few Left to Dream of U.S.
